comments.body: The reason it’s exclusive to certain windows 10 computers is because the hardware required to run it is only in computers. If put on a mobile device the performance would be so poor that the game would be practically unplayable. If it could run on all platforms it most certainly would, but as it can’t, it won’t.

RTX is a feature that requires a supported DirectX ray tracing GPU such as NVIDIA GeForce RTX, which can only be installed on PCs. So I don’t think that adding RTX as a regular option for all platforms would be possible
can not happen, unless there is a RAY TRACING GPU for Android/PS4/NINTENDO/XBOX
I agree that it should be added for more low end users who can't pay for a whole brand new computer with rtx
Yes it would
If this doesn’t happen vote Sven when we vote for the 9 dogs to be in the game.
A bouncing animation while riding horses or striders would be great. The actual animation is so lifeless and static, it do not transmit the feeling of using another living being for transportation!
I agree. This would make it more realistic.
They should make it more like real life, instead of the horse just moving its legs fast, make it so it can trot, canter, and gallop. Sorta like Zelda Breath of The Wild.

Geez I'm waiting for Minecraft PS5 edition since PS5 released and its already getting annoying, I feel like I don't want to spend on marketplace anymore cuz PC is always best to play Minecraft. PS5 have Ray Tracing but its years late!!!
Agreed! The ps5 version has so much potential, especially with the adaptive triggers. Can’t wait to see what the team cooks up! Hopefully they will get good feedback.
Please, my fluctuation level on 1.18 I stupid, I can't play snapshots on a normal world you need this feature!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I suport you but can we also do xbox one s too?
I support this idea, it's really unfair that there are no shaders on the console, the new gen is actually able to run the super duper package
perhaps it could be an option on the game launcher to hoose from the new one, the previous one and maybe the old logos (+ the april fools day logos)
a mod/resource pack might be able to change that. But I have no idea whether or not those things are even possible.
Good news: Caves and Cliffs changed the bright red to dark gray!
I think in the launcher there is an option to enable dark mode for the initial loading screen so it's dark Gray instead of red
there is a setting in accessability to make the background dark!

Yes. The fox eyes is strange. Ne to be moved ti center with 1 pixels. Like to Dogs.
but what
Nah, I think the eyes shouldn't move. But make them cross-eyed, please. It looks uglier when the pupils are facing outwards.
the foxes do look cute but they are a bit derpy
please DON'T
Ever since fox's came out in Minecraft I wished they wolf eyes, right now they could look so much better
Foxes need to have eyes like the wolves, get rid of the 3th pixel and make they cross-eyed isntead of that derpy look, also maybe make their eyes one pixel closer to each other.
tbh I'd be fine with it as long as it was a setting in the options menu
Hmm, I don’t like it. Motion Blur turns games into an eye melting mess.
This post was made after an identical post the day before.
Make it as a option to have or not have motion blur and you can make it blurer of less blurer

If using Optifine, then appending _e to the PNG marks it as an emissive texture. Good for blocks and entities other than a glow squid etc. But I'd absolutely love to see the ability to natively add emissive layer to a player skin. In case maybe their eyes glow, or something.

I don't hate the new look but i also don't understand why they needed to create a new ui type. everything they're doing could already be done in the old jsonui and oreui can't be overwritten by resource packs.
yes I would love to be if it would be removable
this still makes legacy console edition better than bedrock because of everyone hating the Ore UI and making it impossible to remove.
and useful for recreating old legacy console any maybe older versions of java edition
I would like it to be toggleable, i hate it so bad, and some other people like it, so if it toggleable it would he good

ı dont like the ne ui this is absloutely bad PLEASE MOJANG!! REMOVE THİS FEATURE

texture packs better than ore ui

Really? In my opinion, the new oreui is the ONLY good thing about bedrock edition... i understand you prefer the old ui but you can't just ask to remove it, as I (and many other people) really like the new look. Honestly, it should be a toggle in the settings as if they remove it to please some people, they will end up making other people annoyed and wanting it back.

(I am waiting for Oreui to come to java as a toggle, that would look really nice)

"the only good thing about bedrock" is objectively wrong. even if you like it (and good luck with getting others on board with no-toggle-un-retexturable-unpopular-oreui) there are better things about bedrock then java in both subjective and objective ways. can run on a potato without needing a mod for usable performance with a $1000 computer and easier cross-play for cheap and expensive devices are objective things better about bedrock, and subjective is with parity like no 1.9 combat and easier tridents.

also one of the main gripes is the fact there IS no toggle on bedrock so careful what you wish for, a mob of bedrockers might come knock down mojang's office if java gets a toggle and we don't.

and yes we can in fact ask for the unwanted feature for an unbroken thing to be removed :)
I also hate it a lot. JSON UI is native and much more responsive. They could just retexture it and don't create a browser-like GUI system

Mojang, I feel there are similarities between Bedrock's OreUI and Samsung's OneUI. The similarities I've found are as follows: 1. OneUI and OreUI both only allow for basic customization. In OneUI, you can install themes, but only system icons and wallpapers can be changed. Similarly, OreUI currently only supports changing panoramas and home screen buttons; nothing else can be changed. However, there are also differences here: 1. OneUI has Goodlock, which allows users to edit third-party app icons, change themes, appearance, layouts, and more, without voiding the warranty. However, OreUI is locked and cannot be freely modified like it was with JsonUI. Mojang, please create a package that allows editing OreUI separately from the ResourcePack or create a new readable folder within the ResourcePack. This is all I can assess for this new OreUI. Hopefully Mojang reads this! Also, FIX MOJANG BEDROCK!
Maybe they've just never gone outside in their lives and didn't know that, cut them some slack
Microsoft doesn't let Mojang developers leave their development cages, it's only natural they wouldn't know about pine needles
Yes please that would be more realistic I enjoy the idea
I think it would look cool if pine trees had pine needles falling from them instead! It could give pine forests a cool aesthetic

How do you propose to make it better?  We can say make it fun.  Here’s how to make it better:

 

1. Utilize the M1 chip, its much more powerful than phones, so give it a workout.

2.  Utilize the magic Keyboard.  Allow the keyboard to work just like in regular bedrock.

3.  Allow 120 hz frame rate.

4.  Release a Java edition full feature edition for IPads with the M1 chip.  That solves all the above.
or maybe a texture using the new soul sand
But it's made using a normal stick so it makes no sense to change the texture, unless they added warped or crimson sticks
I think they should make it more similar to redstone torches
I don't agree with this. It is bound to cause controversy. Their attire is enough.
Yeah I do agree but since since Minecraft is trying to expand to different countries (e. Minecraft China) and Villagers are pretty much Humans I think this should be atleast an option ingame
I'm on board considering this would add even more variation than there already is!

I think the skin tone should be random, now that we're talking about village looks, what about given them some hair?

People talking about controversy are stupid.
Any skin colour should be possible anywhere. It should have a perfectly equal chance of getting any skin colour when spawning.
This is such a great idea! And it would make a lot of sense after the announcement during Minecraft live that they are trying to improve representation :D
plss yes
I Just want to say thank you to all who are following and have voted on this idea. It is truly appreciated!
Hopefully, the model can be brought back for the classic pack too.
Since they brought back the old crying obsidian texture in Programmer Art, this makes perfect sense

I too would love to have back the footprint particle.

Though it is still in the code, you can't spawn it in with commands, like everything else.

Mojang should add the footprint particle as an option in the list of particles when typing out the command.
Please! This particle was something I was obsessed with. I miss it so bad! It's not even fully removed, the texture is still in the game, so I don't understand why it was removed as a command option
I hope they will add it quickly since they already have the code for this feature and they put it in the April Fools version. Please Mojang :D
I totally agree with you. Every modern game now has a resolution slider. Java edition also has a resolution slider, and having one in Minecraft Windows 10 would be nice.
No, no, no. That would be way too useful! Why would they do that?

Yes! I need this. I want to see if I can render this at the lowest possible resolution and see what performance I get. I can get 100 with it now, but I want to see if I can get a thousand. I would love it if they added this as well as some more customization features.
Definently for consoles but i have a feeling it would be to intensive for raytracing enabled phones as Minecraft RTX is fully path-traced
LET US CHANGE FROM VIBRANT VISUALS
it hurts the eyes, looks like a bug and does not assist with motion sickness, PLEASE TAKE IT OUT
Great idea! One condition though; make it a free texture pack so people can still enjoy the normal game without it.
This could get more attention if it was reposted to the vibrant visuals post. Maybe move it there!

Agreed. With different variants of crafting tables, they could be more easily integrated into the environment around them (a oak crafting table in a yellow house doesn't really fit). Also, this would allow for non-flammable crafting tables (warped and crimson) which would be useful in the Nether.

Another idea I had (based on this) was different variants of smithing tables, stonecutters, smokers, and even the wood on your bed.
